title: Seven charts that explain the plastic pollution problem - BBC
body: All the BBC's news on plastic pollution It is estimated debris takes about six years to reach the centre of the North Pacific gyre from the coast of the US, and about a year from Japan. All five...
readable_content:
- Good read
- Thanks for sharing this article (2017-12-09): It's alarming to see the impact of plastic pollution on marine life. The statistics and explanations provided here give a clear picture of how widespread and damaging the issue is.

- Agreed, the numbers are quite staggering. It's concerning to see the level of plastic waste that ends up in the oceans annually. The impact on marine life and the potential consequences for human health are worrying.
summary:
The conversation expresses concern about the impact of plastic pollution on marine life and the potential consequences for human health. The sentiment is supportive of addressing the issue. 

Sentiment: 0.9
